intro: Roupala griotii, commonly known as the African hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its fruits are capsules that release seeds when mature. Roupala griotii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
